intro: Sericanthe, commonly known as the rock fig, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Moraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The fruit is a fig-like structure that is typically edible and used in local cuisines. Sericanthe species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid environments.
